revised_title: The Influence of Carbonic Acid and Oxygen on Blood Coagulability
tldr: The author conducted experiments on dogs and rabbits to study the effect of carbonic acid and oxygen on blood coagulability. They found that an increase in carbonic acid in the blood promotes coagulation, while a decrease in oxygen has a retarding effect on coagulation. This research helps to understand the role of carbonic acid and oxygen in blood coagulation and intravascular coagulation in specific vascular areas.
